instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3302 no power
threads.message:
Only the first led lights when you turn on the SMC_ONOFF.
There was a short in C9480. I replaced the Q7950, but without result.

Voltage: 
- PP12V_S5 12.07V
- PP5V_S5 4.97V
- PP3V3_S5 3.30V
- PP12V_S0 0V

threads.title: 820-3302 no power
threads.message:
LED501 doesn't lit before pressing the power button?
Do you note any pulse on other LEDs when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
Also check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-3302 no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 79599, member: 682"]
LED501 doesn't lit before pressing the power button?
[/QUOTE]

Yes, it does.
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 79599, member: 682"]
Do you note any pulse on other LEDs when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
[/QUOTE]

No pulse on LEDs when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L.
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 79599, member: 682"]
Also check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).
[/QUOTE]

Yes, there is a pulse drop in PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-3302 no power
threads.message:
"Yes, there is a pulse drop in PM_PWRBTN_L."
Then check for pulse at PN_SLP_S4_L, at same time.

BTW, inch style quotes ("") make the post more aesthetic than the way you've choosed...

threads.title: 820-3302 no power
threads.message:
''Then check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, at same time."
It starts at 0V and when it triggers the SMC_ONOFF is high at 3,3V.

threads.title: 820-3302 no power
threads.message:
Then you should have 12V_S0 present.
Change Q7950.
